Okey... I was make clean re-install windows(win 7 pro 64bit)...and  i was install sp1 too....now this "grey box" is gone and powerdvd works like charm... :) so...seem like problem is microsoft.. :P

install "tip" :) you can activate powerdvd in offline...put these to registry and you can use serials to activation...

HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\CyberLink\PowerDVD11\CustomReg

 32bit OS:
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\CyberLink\PowerDVD11\CustomReg]
 "UI_UpgradeStrategy"=dword:00000000

 x64 OS:
 [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\CyberLink\PowerDVD11\CustomReg]
 "UI_UpgradeStrategy"=dword:00000000

after that, you can put serial in offline mode...
Some serials:
UL3RX-VCRNZ-5AMJB-X942S-DUTXV-FYRPV
NDLZN-YZE38-B75HA-HCVLL-QPPKJ-3X6MF
UM8W2-8A9MQ-S9ZW6-HV7KE-VVFNX-TJDPU
S66J2-DRMTC-2FMLT-LHNCR-SPDBL-5YJF9
T7KYE-D8YPL-AQKS7-8MCUU-6N83T-3GBBN
7XR6P-8G6EQ-HXWXP-CFPAT-TJJYU-4VPJ7
X5X77-5BZJF-VG7UV-W777F-F53DN-5KRRY
LMNTY-YU85C-ZVVGS-PUJH3-CZCW9-9PJQ9

I installed this on Win 7 Ultimate x64 and didn't have the gray box but I didn't have any control over the controls like play, stop, ff, and rewind.  Comparing this to 10, when playing Video TS file, on 10 you could just click Video TS without opening the folder and hit play and it would play the movie.  With 11 when trying it and just clicking Video TS, it wouldn't let me hit play and I had to open the directory and then I could only select one file and hit play if I remember correctly which then I realized that I had no control with the functions.

I did not uninstall 10 because I thought that this would overwrite it so maybe that caused a problem and maybe it didn't so after having the issues, just deleted 11 and still had 10.  Never did try inserting a DVD though and seeing what would happen with it?
Forgot to mention thanks though for your work!  Hopefully a fix will be out in the coming release.
Don't leave the cursor in the gray box... Just leave it inside the video screen... Now that gray box and the cursor will hide automatically.....
Don't leave the cursor in the gray box Qbaz... Just leave it inside the video screen... Now that gray box and the cursor will hide automatically.....

@ mahapash: Download and reinstall this release and it's activated.

@ Exodus1992: It plays MKVs without much pixellation here, but it depends on the quality of the MKV. You can try updating your video card drivers or wait for an updated version of PowerDVD.

@ADHDerby : The prob was with the codecs , i just solved them myself, Thanks for app once more !

New updated version (build 1719): http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6428287

Updated:
- Add YouTube search function
- Improve 3D file, BD3D, side-by-side BDAV playback support
- Improve DLNA playback support and DTCP-IP activation flow
- Improve file playback support on IFO, M3U, PM4
- Improve nVidia 3DVision support on 3D playback over HDMI 1.4 connection

Resolved Issues:
- Keyboard control could not work in CyberLink PowerDVD Cinema mode
- MCE-remote control could not work correctly in CyberLink PowerDVD cinema mode
- CyberLink PowerDVD could not launch on specific ATI platform
- CyberLink PowerDVD could not close correctly when launched from Windows Media Center
- CyberLink PowerDVD could not keep HD Audio or TT-Surround setting after stop playback
- CyberLink PowerDVD did not have Dolby Headphone setting in advance menu
- Fullscreen playback on secondary display has letterbox issue
- File association does not work
- Translation issues

Be carefull, if you remove WMP then, bray box will reappear.
